data.title: A nice walk.
data.text: The trail is well-maintained, and short enough (3/4 mile) for young children to walk on their own.  Just be sure to bring water.  It's a shared (bike/walk) trail, but I didn't see any evidence of bikes when I was there.

data.title: beautiful walk around indian mound
data.text: I stopped here on my way to visit friends in Florida. It was a beautiful park and walks around the mounds were beautiful and well kept up

data.title: My grandkids loved it
data.text: I went with the grandkids,  They enjoyed the walk along the river,  I appreciated the benches along the way.

data.title: Good Run along the river
data.text: I decided to take a jog down the Heritage Trail and found it quite cool and peaceful.  I really like that that is was all paved and seemed very safe.  I have now run along both sides of the River.  I cant wait until they finish the DT side of the river where the Otis Redding statue is.  The only reason that I did not give it all five marks is that there were several spots that were covered up with dirt due to erosion. Otherwise, I recommend you try it.

data.title: Ocmulgee Heritage Trail
data.text: It's a nice break, the trails are landscaped beautifully. I enjoyed the history of the mounds and the area.

data.title: very historical
data.text:
it was very informative and cool to see everything from history 
very pet friendly 
enjoyed the mounds but entrance was tiny and the small dogs we have were very leary about going inside especially with it only having one way in or out

data.title: Didn't intend to walk this trail but it is so inviting that we did.
data.text: We had the perfect day and we planned on just walking over to one of the mounds.  And then there was another one not that far away, and the bridge looked interesting, and ... and... before we actually realized it we were well along the path and not overly tired so we decided how far we wanted to go and planned the rest of our hike.  There were wildflowers blooming along side of the paths, nothing rare but all were pretty.  It made for a great afternoon.  Trails were very well marked and maintained.

data.title: nice place with family with children
data.text: Love the outdoor park! it's very informative for people traveling and want to know the history. It's very clean and great for children

data.title: Great Place To Exercise & Experience Macon!!
data.text: Great Place To Exercise & Experience Macon!! The trails are all beautifully maintained & landscaped.

data.title: Otis Redding statue - a risky business
data.text: We wanted to look at the Otis Redding statue in Gateway Park.  Couldn't even get close as there were many suspect and undesirable looking drunks all around the access point on a Sunday afternoon.  We did not feel safe and promptly left.

data.title: An Interesting Surprise
data.text: It was a great walking trail.  It was an unplanned trip as I was in the  area for something else. I recommend this as a to do and a way to learn a little more history.

data.title: Pretty green trail next to water
data.text: I passed through Macon on my way to Florida and took a break to walk this trail.  It is pretty nice, with a good amount of greenery and views of the water.  In thr morning there were people walking and jogging but it never got too crowded.  Not amazing but definitely worth doing.

data.title: Great place to walk and play
data.text: We like to come here at least once a week with our babies and walk them in the stroller. Very beautiful and pleasant walk. A nice play area for kids as well.

data.title: Very pleasant park!
data.text:
A friend and I went here this evening to enjoy a fast food meal we'd purchased around the corner. The parking lot had plenty of open spaces, and the nature trail is multi-use for walkers, joggers, and cyclists. So you might want to stay to the right as you go, so that people can pass on the left.

Nice trail as it meanders through the trees. Very very green, with the river on the right as the trail follows it. We walked in maybe half a mile, but I've heard it goes for about 11 miles. Check it out and let us know.

Item of note: there are concrete "domes" that stick up out of the ground among the lawn. They reminded me of the entrances where the Morlocks entered the underground in the 1960 movie The Time Machine with Rod Taylor (RIP).  The covers of these domes are embossed with the word "Sewer." And as you'll walk deeper into the trail, you'll be well aware of the sewer, as the stench somewhat follows it for a little while. So heads up on that.

Here's a tip: bring a frisbee.  Great area for it.

data.title: Great place to walk
data.text: We thought this would be a bit more scenic than it was, but it was a nice, clean, and safe pathway to get some exercise along the river bank. would have been perfect for a bike ride.

data.title: Fun and scenic
data.text: If you complete the entire trail, which is miles, you get a shirt :) It is beautiful and educational and takes you through the best spots. Take a camera :)

data.title: Nice chance to get outside.
data.text: Close to downtown and the Marriott, this nice greenway winds along the river with benches, playground and information kiosks.  We did not have a chance to explore the whole distance but enjoyed the several miles we walked.

data.title: Preserving ancient history of 1000's years
data.text: Small gift shop, trail to walk around mounds and observe scenic area. Preservation of this area was required to keep the area from being destroyed.

data.title: Appears not to be completed yet
data.text:
Went biking on the trail. Nice views of river and other scenery. Different types of trees are identified throughout the trail. Additionally, the trail has distance markers throughout. Very easy trail to bike as the paved section is completely flat. The actual map lists the mileage at 11 however, it appears not to be complete yet as my wife and I rode the entire trail and then some resulting in only 7 miles. 

The entry to the park is conveniently located just off Interstate 16. So for travelers wanting a quick break from driving, it is a nice stop.

A boat ramp is also on the trail and I have observed kayaks on the river. Additionally, a sign is posted at the boat ramp revealing to be careful of currents if swimming. Thus, I assume you are permitted to swim in the river.

Looking forward to when the trail is completed as it is a nice leisurely bike ride.

data.title: Great park to visit
data.text: Ocmulgee Heritage Trail is a great place to go for something different. The scenery is beautiful and peaceful with security so you can feel safe.
